column2: For some U.S. companies
column3: millennials are giving way to Generation Z NEW YORK
column4: May 25 A small but growing number of companies are starting to target Generation Z - the 69 million high school-age kids and younger who will soon outnumber the millennials before them - and they are not just pitching typical teen products such as acne creams and video games.

column4: co-head of high yield capital markets for emerging Asia
column5: has left JP Morgan. Garner is said to have left his post last month.  Since joining JPM in New York in 2001
